title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\NodeGroup
name: NodeGroup
description:
Represents a sole-tenant Node Group resource. A sole-tenant node is a physical server that is dedicated to hosting VM instances only for your specific project. Use sole-tenant nodes to keep your instances physically separated from instances in other projects, or to group your instances together on the same host hardware. For more information, read Sole-tenant nodes.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.NodeGroup

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.autoscaling_policy
params.description: Specifies how autoscaling should behave.

params.name: data.creation_timestamp
params.description: [Output Only] Creation timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.description
params.description: An optional description of this resource. Provide this property when you create the resource.

params.name: data.id
params.description: [Output Only] The unique identifier for the resource. This identifier is defined by the server.

params.name: data.kind
params.description: [Output Only] The type of the resource. Always compute#nodeGroup for node group.

params.name: data.location_hint
params.description: An opaque location hint used to place the Node close to other resources. This field is for use by internal tools that use the public API. The location hint here on the NodeGroup overrides any location_hint present in the NodeTemplate.

params.name: data.maintenance_policy
params.description: Specifies how to handle instances when a node in the group undergoes maintenance. Set to one of: DEFAULT, RESTART_IN_PLACE, or MIGRATE_WITHIN_NODE_GROUP. The default value is DEFAULT. For more information, see Maintenance policies. Check the MaintenancePolicy enum for the list of possible values.

params.name: data.name
params.description: The name of the resource, provided by the client when initially creating the resource. The resource name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035. Specifically, the name must be 1-63 characters long and match the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? which means the first character must be a lowercase letter, and all following characters must be a dash, lowercase letter, or digit, except the last character, which cannot be a dash.

params.name: data.node_template
params.description: URL of the node template to create the node group from.

params.name: data.self_link
params.description: [Output Only] Server-defined URL for the resource.

params.name: data.size
params.description: [Output Only] The total number of nodes in the node group.

params.name: data.status
params.description: Check the Status enum for the list of possible values.

params.name: data.zone
params.description: [Output Only] The name of the zone where the node group resides, such as us-central1-a.

methods.name: getMaintenancePolicy
methods.description:
Specifies how to handle instances when a node in the group undergoes maintenance. Set to one of: DEFAULT, RESTART_IN_PLACE, or MIGRATE_WITHIN_NODE_GROUP. The default value is DEFAULT. For more information, see Maintenance policies.

Check the MaintenancePolicy enum for the list of possible values.
